citations.narrative:
One raccoon and one squirrel housed at different wildlife rehabilitation locations were exhibited under the licensee’s
authority and USDA license. During the inspection today, the licensee confirmed both animals were exhibited on multiple
occurrences, with the most recent encounter taking place in May 2024. The inspector reminded the licensee only the sites
associated with their USDA license can exhibit animals under the current license and housed therein.
Animals used for regulated activity but housed at locations that have not been assessed and verified by USDA inspectors
prevents the agency from knowing the conditions the animals are housed and maintained. This is required to determine
the facility’s compliance of the Animal Welfare Act and its regulations.
Facilities shall provide valid addresses for all locations, facilities, premises, or sites where animals, animal facilities,
equipment, and records are held, kept, or maintained.
Regulated activities cannot be conducted involving these secondary locations until a new site or prelicensing inspection
has been conducted.
Correct by July 2, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
